Article Title: Yogi Adityanath: Prayagraj led India’s spiritual growth but was neglected since Independence
Article Text: LUCKNOW: Anticipating earnings of around Rs 2 lakh crore from the 2025 Maha Kumbh , chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday questioned the intention of people who are raising objections to the govt expenditure on the event.Speaking as chief guest at the ‘Divine Uttar Pradesh – The Must Visit Sacred Journey’, a conclave organised by The Times of India to celebrate the immense potential of the Kumbh to drive growth and development in the state and to mark the first anniversary of the consecration of the idol of Ram Lalla in Ayodhya , The CM justified the govt’s investment of Rs 5,000 crore on Maha Kumbh.“The arrival of crores of devotees in the state would ensure that much more comes back to the govt,” he said.Drawing a comparison between the condition of religious cities like Ayodhya and Varanasi before 2017 and in the last few years, the CM said, “Before 2017, barely 50 lakh devotees visited Varanasi in a year. In 2024, the city attracted 16 crore visitors. In 2016, 2.83 lakh domestic devotees and 1,200 foreign tourists visited Ayodhya. However, from Jan to Sep in 2024, 13.55 crore visitors came to Ayodhya.”“When a devotee visits UP, he uses transport, eats in a restaurant, lives in a hotel, shops. If he spends an average of Rs 5,000 per visit, by that calculation, only Varanasi earns Rs 80,000 crore,” he said.Yogi said that 40 crore people were expected to visit Prayagraj for Maha Kumbh and the govt was anticipating earnings of Rs 2 lakh crore.“With expected revenue of such a magnitude, what is wrong in spending Rs 5,000 crore in bringing modernity and technology to a cultural and spiritual event. The people who are questioning us are those who feel proud over their association with foreign invaders and not India. They don’t like the development of Ayodhya, Prayagraj, Mathura-Vrindavan or Varanasi. They divide people on caste, religious and regional lines. We should have no expectations from them. As govt, it is our moral duty to organise such an event,” Yogi said.“This (Maha Kumbh Nagar) will be the world’s largest temporary city. At any given point of time, there will be 1.5 crore seers and devotees there. The floating population will be in crores. On Mauni Amavasya, my estimate is that 8-10 crore people will take the holy dip in the Ganga,” he said.“Preparations to handle such crowds started well in time with the agenda of making this Maha Kumbh a clean and safe event. In the past, toilets would be affixed to the sand and the waste would flow directly into the river. Since 2019, our govt planned for zero discharge toilets and waste is being treated through bioremediation and STPs. This year, 1.5 lakh toilets will be available which can be located through smartphones and digital tourist maps,” he added.The CM said that Artificial Intelligence was being used for security and an additional 5,000 acres of land had been earmarked for parking. To provide easy accessibility, shuttle buses, e-rickshaws, battery-operated vehicles and over 8,000 buses of Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) had been pressed into service. “The Sangam Nose has been expanded to deal with congestion,” he said.“Some people might not like how much work has been done. We will make sure that those who are unable to see the work are made to see it,” he said.Terming Prayagraj as an ancient city which led India’s spiritual growth, he said that the city, which propelled some people to the height of power, was left ignored since Independence. “It was Prime Minister Narendra Modi who planned sustainable growth for the city,” the CM said.“More than 200 roads were developed just last year itself. Underpasses were expanded, 14 flyovers were made in just one year and 30 pontoon bridges were constructed in the Mela area,” he said.“Maha Kumbh is a testament to India’s rich spiritual and cultural legacy. The event offers people from across the nation and the world a chance to reconnect with their ancient traditions and cultural roots. Its purpose goes beyond fostering religious devotion, aiming to inspire and guide future generations,” he said.“The upcoming Maha Kumbh will be a grand, divine, and digitally advanced event. Spanning across 10,000 acres, it will set an exemplary standard for cleanliness, security, and modernity. To enhance the convenience of devotees, a digital tourist map will facilitate monitoring the cleanliness of toilets, while an AI-powered security system integrated with smartphones will ensure safety,” the CM said.Chief minister Yogi Adityanath remarked that those unfamiliar with the science of river management might fail to understand that channeling a river enhances its vitality rather than diminishing its natural essence.Lamenting that people did not listen to Rishi Ved Vyas when he said that the path to development would be highlighted through dharma, the CM said had his words been taken seriously, India would not have faced foreign invasion and had its spiritual and religious traditions insulted.“It was finally under PM Modi that one started taking pride in India’s history and their ancestors, " he remarked.The CM said that when one visited Kashi Vishwanath before 2014, one found it in a pathetic state. “If one visited Ayodhya, one would not want to go there again. Similar was the case with Kumbh in Prayagraj. If someone left for Uttarakhand Char Dham in the past, there was no guarantee of his return,” he said.“This situation was created by those who now question the arrangements and tradition of Kumbh. In 2013, the Mauritius PM visited the Kumbh and went to the Sangam to take a dip. However, when he reached there and saw the filth, he could not believe it was Ganga and went back to his country with tears in his eyes. In 1916, Mahatma Gandhi visited Kashi Vishwanath and when he saw the mess, he said that if someone from another planet reached there, he would think he was in hell,” the CM said.
Article Summary: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath justified the govt’s investment of Rs 5,000 crore on Maha Kumbh. “The arrival of crores of devotees in the state would ensure that much more comes back to the state,” he said. Yogi said that 40 crore people were expected to visit Prayagraj.

Article Title: 2024 was hottest year ever & first to breach 1.5°C mark: EU report
Article Text:
FILE - A woman tries to cool herself while waiting for a bus on a hot day in Skopje, North Macedonia, June 20, 2024. (AP Photo/Boris Grdanoski, File)

Risks include heatwaves & agricultural disruption: Report

DEHRADUN: The Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S), part of the European Union's Earth observation programme, has officially confirmed 2024 as the hottest year globally since records began in 1850. Global temperatures averaged 1.6°C above pre-industrial levels, making it the first calendar year to surpass the critical 1.5°C threshold . Surface air temperatures reached an average of 15.10°C, exceeding the 2023 record by 0.12°C, intensifying concerns about the worsening climate crisis .Scientists attributed the record-breaking heat to human-induced climate change, amplified by the El Nino phenomenon that continued into the first four months of 2024. Carlo Buontempo, director of C3S at the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), said, "All of the internationally produced global temperature datasets show that 2024 was the hottest year since records began in 1850. The future is in our hands - swift and decisive action can still alter this trajectory."The findings from C3S revealed that the past decade, from 2015 to 2024, was the warmest on record. Every month from Jan to June 2024, temperatures were recorded higher than in previous months.Additionally, all months since July 2023 - except July 2024 - exceeded the 1.5°C threshold. A new daily global average temperature record of 17.16°C was set on July 22, 2024, further underscoring the rapid pace of climate change. Extreme weather events defined the year, with record atmospheric water vapour levels driving catastrophic heatwaves, floods and wildfires across the globe.Canada recorded its second-highest wildfire carbon emissions, while Bolivia and Venezuela reported their highest-ever emissions. Global sea surface temperatures reached an unprecedented high of 20.87°C, further contributing to heat stress and ecological disruptions.The report also highlighted the continued decline in sea ice levels. Antarctic sea ice extents approached record lows, while Arctic Sea ice levels fell well below average later in the year. Greenhouse gas concentrations surged, with carbon dioxide levels reaching 422 parts per million and methane concentrations rising to 1,897 parts per billion. Samantha Burgess, ECMWF's climate strategic lead, warned, "Humanity is teetering on the edge of the Paris Agreement's goals. These numbers are a stark reminder of the need for urgent, collaborative action."Reacting to the findings, Anjal Prakash, director of Bharti Institute of Public Policy at Indian School of Business, Hyderabad, said, "As south Asia grapples with unprecedented temperature rise documented in the 2024 Global Climate Highlights, it is imperative to recognise the profound impact of this crisis on our region. With 2024 marking a critical threshold, we face heightened risks, including intensified heatwaves, flooding and agricultural disruption."
Article Summary: Global temperatures averaged 1.6°C above pre-industrial levels. Surface air temperatures reached an average of 15.10°C, exceeding the 2023 record by 0.12°C. Scientists attributed the record-breaking heat to human-induced climate change.

Article Title: ‘Maha Kumbh is an occasion for peace, soul searching & spiritual enhancement’
Article Text:
Yatindra Mishra highlights Maha Kumbh as a profound event for spiritual cleansing and self-discovery. Experts discuss its impact on UP's religious tourism, stressing the need for sustainable development in Prayagraj, Varanasi, and Ayodhya.

Maha Kumbh is an occasion to cleanse one’s soul, said author and culturist Yatindra Mishra, setting off an insightful discussion on the essence of the grandest religious congregation on the planet.“Prayagraj and Kumbh help one experience self-forgetfulness, ecstasy, truthfulness and the state of absolute bliss or inner freedom. Kumbh is a place to search for one’s own self,” said Mishra.Delving into the topic of discussion — ‘Maha Kumbh 2025: A Maha push to UP’s religious tourism economy’ — he said, “Just as we clean our shoes, mirror, spectacles, we should wash off the filth from our souls at Kumbh. And the Kumbh journey is incomplete without visiting Ayodhya.”“Kumbh’s journey is meant for soul searching and not making reels or posts for social media. What is Kumbh if you merely end up posting pics of holy dips on Instagram. Kumbh’s purpose, metaphorically, is also to discover the lost knowledge, just as Saraswati is lost between the Ganga and the Yamuna in Triveni but still remains significant.”Sharing that the Indian Institute of Management Lucknow is undertaking a study on Kumbh mela, Priyanka Sharma, associate professor at the institute, said, “Places of religious tourism like Prayagraj , Ayodhya and Varanasi hold significance among the people due to their diverse dimensions. Tourism for people now is not limited to holidays in hotels or restaurants, rather it is for peace and spiritual enhancement .”Prof Pravin Singh Rana, who teaches tourism management at the Banaras Hindu University, defined religious tourism thus: “Kashi kabhau naa chodiye Vishwanath darbar; marne par Shankar milne, jiyate langda aam (There are no desires here. Eventually, it’s Lord Shiv everywhere. Only fruits and flowers are needed for sustenance).”Rana emphasised on overall development of religious destinations such as Prayagraj, Varanasi and Ayodhya. “Event specific development needs to change; for instance, Prayagraj will go to sleep post-Kumbh. That should not happen,” he said.Speaking on the need for geological and eco-tourism, Rana shared that UP govt has submitted a dossier on Salakhan Fossils Park in Sonbhadra. “If it is accepted, it will be a major attraction for tourists visiting Kashi. Similarly, outer development of Ayodhya should also be done,” he said.Stressing on staying healthy during Kumbh visit, Dr Lokendra Gupta, head of the emergency department at Medanta hospital and founder president of Society of Acute Care Trauma & Emergency Medicine (SACTEM), said, “Emergency medicine is a life saving subject and we have collaborated with govt and imparted training to paramedics, nurses on saving life during the golden hour.”A team of over 650 experts including doctors, nursing, paramedics all are posted in Kumbh Mela, besides a 100-bed central hospital and six 20 beds hospitals with a separate ICU facility have been set up. “The 2019 Kumbh surveillance showed enhanced cases of lower respiratory tract infections, trauma post animal bites. Time and trained staff are the key to handling such cases and that’s what we are focussing on this time,” Gupta said.
Article Summary: Maha Kumbh is an occasion to cleanse one’s soul, said author and culturist Yatindra Mishra. Experts discuss its impact on UP's religious tourism, stressing the need for sustainable development in Prayagraj, Varanasi, and Ayodhya.

Article Title: 'Byah ho gaya tumhara': OYO’s new check-in policy for unmarried couples sparks meme storm online
Article Text:
OYO new check-in policy: Overview and implementation



Rationale behind OYO new policy



Public reactions and social memes on OYO new policy

Also read |

|

|

OYO , one of India’s most prominent hotel booking platforms, has introduced a controversial new check-in policy specifically targeting unmarried couples. This revised policy requires couples to present proof of their relationship during check-in, a move that has ignited significant debate and widespread reactions on social media. Currently implemented in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, the policy reflects OYO’s attempt to balance local societal norms with its business operations. As the company evaluates feedback, there is speculation about whether the policy will extend to other cities.The revised check-in policy prohibits unmarried couples from staying at OYO partner hotels unless they can provide valid proof of their relationship. According to reports, the new guidelines apply to both online and offline bookings.Discretionary power for partner hotels: OYO has granted its partner hotels the authority to accept or deny bookings based on their judgment. This flexibility allows hotels to align with local cultural and social norms, a critical factor in regions like Meerut, where traditional values often influence public perception.Current rollout in Meerut: The policy is currently being trialed in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh. OYO stated that the decision to expand these guidelines to other cities will depend on the feedback and responses gathered during this initial phase.OYO explained that the updated guidelines are part of its broader strategy to enhance its brand image and cater to a wider audience. The company aims to foster a safe and comfortable environment for its diverse clientele, including families, students, solo travelers, and business visitors.The company also hopes this move will encourage longer stays and repeat bookings by improving customer trust and satisfaction. By aligning with local norms, OYO seeks to strengthen its relationship with its partner hotels while addressing societal expectations.The announcement of OYO’s revised policy has sparked significant debate online, with reactions ranging from criticism to humor. Many social media users expressed disappointment, viewing the policy as regressive and discriminatory. Critics argued that it infringes on personal freedoms and undermines the company’s reputation as a modern and inclusive brand.The policy has also become a subject of jokes and memes, with users mocking OYO’s decision. A popular tweet summarized the sentiment humorously, stating, “OYO is digging its own grave.” These reactions highlight the broader societal divide over issues of personal relationships and privacy.
Article Summary: OYO has introduced a controversial new check-in policy specifically targeting unmarried couples. This revised policy requires couples to present proof of their relationship during check- in. The move has ignited significant debate and widespread reactions on social media. Currently implemented in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, the policy reflects OYO’s attempt to balance local societal norms with its business operations.

Article Title: Russell Wilson’s Wife Ciara Joins LA Wildfire Relief Efforts, Requests Donations from Fans
Article Text:
Credit: Getty Images and X

Russell Wilson’s Wife Ciara Calls on Fans to Contribute to LA County Wildfire Relief Efforts



Los Angeles is grappling with a nightmarish scenario – multiple wildfires raging across the county, displacing residents and causing widespread devastation. While firefighters bravely battle the blazes, the community has rallied together to support those affected. Grammy award-winning singer Ciara, wife of star quarterback Russell Wilson , has leveraged her platform to advocate for wildfire relief efforts. A champion for positive change, Ciara is a strong supporter of Baby2Baby , a non-profit organization with a history of aiding communities in crisis.The devastating wildfires in Los Angeles County have left a trail of destruction, burning tens of thousands of acres, damaging homes, and displacing thousands of residents. The fires, including the Palisades, Eaton, Hurst, Woodley, Lidia, and Sunset blazes, have been fueled by fierce winds, creating a situation of immense devastation. As of now, over 2,000 structures have been destroyed, particularly between Malibu and Santa Monica, and the loss is still rising.In the face of such tragedy, Grammy Award-winning artist Ciara has stepped forward with a powerful plea for public support to help the victims of the fires. Known for her philanthropic work, Ciara took to Instagram to call for donations through Baby2Baby, a nonprofit organization that provides essentials to children in need. The charity has long been at the forefront of aiding communities in crisis, and Ciara's leadership has been crucial in expanding its reach. During Baby2Baby's November 2024 gala, the organization raised a record-breaking $17.1 million, surpassing the previous year’s total by $5 million."Every little bit will make a difference!! We are in this together. Donate whatever you can here," Ciara shared alongside a link to the Baby2Baby donation page.Beyond her recent appeal, Ciara has a long history of philanthropic work. Alongside her husband, NFL quarterback Russell Wilson, she co-founded the Why Not You Foundation, which focuses on youth empowerment and education. Their foundation has been active in numerous charitable efforts, including a recent initiative in Pittsburgh that distributed 400 coats, books, and winter essentials to children in need. In 2023, the Wilsons donated $1 million to Colorado-based organizations, demonstrating their commitment to giving back. Russell Wilson was honored with the Walter Payton Man of the Year award in 2020 for his extensive community service, including his significant contributions during the pandemic.As the fires continue to ravage the Los Angeles area, the NFL has made adjustments to ensure public safety. In response to the wildfires, the league announced the relocation of the Los Angeles Rams’ wild-card playoff game against the Minnesota Vikings. Originally scheduled for SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, the game will now take place at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The NFL explained the decision as being made "in the interest of public safety," citing air quality concerns, the impact on community resources, and the strain on emergency services. This decision followed a nearby wildfire that erupted close to the Rams' training complex, further emphasizing the ongoing risks.The fire crisis continues to unfold, with over 3.5 million Californians without power and a growing number of casualties. In response, President Joe Biden approved a major disaster declaration, activating federal resources to aid in the recovery efforts. Organizations across the state are providing vital assistance, and those affected by the disaster are urged to seek help through FEMA’s DisasterAssistance.gov portal.Also Read: Matthew Stafford Speaks on Rams’ Playoff Focus as Los Angeles Wildfires Force Game Relocation to Arizona As communities face the aftermath of these devastating wildfires, the collective effort to rebuild and support those affected continues. With leaders like Ciara and Russell Wilson, as well as numerous humanitarian organizations, the Los Angeles area is finding strength in solidarity.
Article Summary: Russell Wilson’s Wife Ciara Calls on Fans to Contribute to LA County Wildfire Relief Efforts. Grammy award-winning singer Ciara, wife of star quarterback Russell Wilson, has leveraged her platform to advocate for wildfire relief efforts. Ciara is a strong supporter of Baby2Baby, a non-profit organization with a history of aiding communities in crisis.
